title: Van Diemen RF01 H Formula Race Car
description: This Van Diemen RF01 H is a closed-wheel race car that has been used in FARA competition since the current owner’s acquisition in 2012, and it has since been supported by FMS Motorsport of Miami, Florida. Power comes from a replacement 998cc Yamaha R1 inline-four equipped with a Mikuni fuel injection system and backed by a five-speed manual transaxle. The car features composite bodywork mounted to a tubular steel chassis, and it rides on a pushrod suspension with remote-reservoir coilovers. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber front splitter, a rear wing, OZ Racing 13” wheels, AP Racing brake calipers, a removable carbon-fiber seat, a MOMO steering wheel, and an AiM digital dashboard. This Van Diemen is now offered in Florida on dealer consignment with two sets of extra wheels and a bill of sale.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Van Diemen RF01 H Formula Race Car at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #185,617.
text: This Van Diemen RF01 H is a closed-wheel race car that has been used in FARA competition since the current owner’s acquisition in 2012, and it has since been supported by FMS Motorsport of Miami, Florida. Power comes from a replacement 998cc Yamaha R1 inline-four equipped with a Mikuni fuel injection system and backed by a five-speed manual transaxle. The car features composite bodywork mounted to a tubular steel chassis, and it rides on a pushrod suspension with remote-reservoir coilovers. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber front splitter, a rear wing, OZ Racing 13” wheels, AP Racing brake calipers, a removable carbon-fiber seat, a MOMO steering wheel, and an AiM digital dashboard. This Van Diemen is now offered in Florida on dealer consignment with two sets of extra wheels and a bill of sale. Van Diemen was founded in 1973 and produced Formula Ford race cars until the company was absorbed by Élan Motorsport Technologies in 2002. This car’s closed-wheel composite bodywork wears a multicolor vinyl wrap with #05 numerals. Details include a carbon-fiber front splitter, a rear wing, and dual side mirrors. Damage on the splitter can be viewed in the image gallery below along with blemishes around the car. OZ Racing 13” alloy wheels are wrapped in 180/55 Hankook racing slicks up front and 240/570 Kumho Ecsta units out back. The car rides on a pushrod suspension with inboard-mounted, remote-reservoir coilovers front and back, and braking is handled by AP Racing calipers and slotted rotors all around. The cockpit houses a removable carbon-fiber racing seat with a Tanaka harness. The MOMO steering wheel is mounted to a quick-release hub and sits ahead of an AiM MyChron3 XG digital dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 2,700 miles. Total mileage is unknown. The 998cc Yamaha R1 inline-four was installed circa 2012 and features a Mikuni individual-throttle-body fuel injection system. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle. The car is said to have accrued approximately two hours of usage on a replacement clutch assembly. Two sets of extra wheels and tires are included in the sale. The car is not legal for road use and carries no title or registration. It is being sold on a bill of sale. html:
This Van Diemen RF01 H is a closed-wheel race car that has been used in FARA competition since the current owner’s acquisition in 2012, and it has since been supported by FMS Motorsport of Miami, Florida. Power comes from a replacement 998cc Yamaha R1 inline-four equipped with a Mikuni fuel injection system and backed by a five-speed manual transaxle. The car features composite bodywork mounted to a tubular steel chassis, and it rides on a pushrod suspension with remote-reservoir coilovers. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber front splitter, a rear wing, OZ Racing 13” wheels, AP Racing brake calipers, a removable carbon-fiber seat, a MOMO steering wheel, and an AiM digital dashboard. This Van Diemen is now offered in Florida on dealer consignment with two sets of extra wheels and a bill of sale.

Van Diemen was founded in 1973 and produced Formula Ford race cars until the company was absorbed by Élan Motorsport Technologies in 2002. This car’s closed-wheel composite bodywork wears a multicolor vinyl wrap with #05 numerals. Details include a carbon-fiber front splitter, a rear wing, and dual side mirrors. Damage on the splitter can be viewed in the image gallery below along with blemishes around the car.

OZ Racing 13” alloy wheels are wrapped in 180/55 Hankook racing slicks up front and 240/570 Kumho Ecsta units out back. The car rides on a pushrod suspension with inboard-mounted, remote-reservoir coilovers front and back, and braking is handled by AP Racing calipers and slotted rotors all around.

The cockpit houses a removable carbon-fiber racing seat with a Tanaka harness.

The MOMO steering wheel is mounted to a quick-release hub and sits ahead of an AiM MyChron3 XG digital dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 2,700 miles. Total mileage is unknown.

The 998cc Yamaha R1 inline-four was installed circa 2012 and features a Mikuni individual-throttle-body fuel injection system.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle. The car is said to have accrued approximately two hours of usage on a replacement clutch assembly.

Two sets of extra wheels and tires are included in the sale.

The car is not legal for road use and carries no title or registration. It is being sold on a bill of sale.
